title: Holly Willoughby and Phillip Schofield brought to tears as they interview mother whose daughter killed herself over cyberbulling
text:
TV Magazine 'Words can kill' Holly Willoughby and Phillip Schofield brought to tears as they interview mother whose daughter killed herself over cyberbulling 
The This Morning presenters struggled to continue By Kala Paul-Worika Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments HOLLY Willoughby and Phillip Schofield struggled to reign in their emotions as they interviewed a mother whose daughter killed herself as a result of cyberbullying. 
The This Morning hosts were brought to tears as they spoke to an emotional Nicola Harteveld ahead of her daughter Megan Evans’ funeral on Monday. ITV 
Megan was 14 when she took her own life after being harassed on social media . 
Phillip said sadly: “I don’t know how your standing up – what a thing for a family to go through.” 
And as Nicola recalled how one particular message pushed the teenager over the edge, the entire studio struggled to continue the interview. 
Nicola explained: “One final message – I think that was the final message that did tip the scales…” related stories so saucy! Phillip continued: “That final message was ‘why don’t you kill yourself’ and she texted back ‘ok’.” 
At that point, as the mother broke down in tears, both Holly and Phil took several pauses to regain their composure, with Phil adding: “It’s getting us all.” 
Giving a word of advice to any teenagers watching, Megan’s mother added: “They just need to ben mindful of people’s situations. 
“Be careful because words can’t be taken back and words can kill. 
“It’s not cool to be a mean girl.”
